taskDescription:
The dimensions of a small storage unit are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>m</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>m</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>m</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3\,{\text{m}} \times 3{\text{m}} \times 3\,{\text{m}}</annotation></semantics></math>. What is the volume of a medium storage area with dimensions twice the size of the small unit?
